The New Museum in New York is preparing to open its new space in the George Eastman Building, which houses the institution’s permanent collection of American art, on February 27. The new space will be named for Eastman, who donated $1 billion to the institution in 2016 and sold off his vast holdings in 2008. The renovation consortium, led by architect Bojana Dimitrić, and landscape designer Robert Foster, along with cultural historian and curator Joseph Cornell, will create a space that will be 144,000 square feet and take up the first floor of the building, which was constructed in 1960 and was renovated in 2017.The renovation will include the addition of new galleries, a bookstore, a movie theater, an outdoor terrace, and the construction of a glass-enclosed sculpture garden that will feature a variety of plants and flowering trees.
